content: i just passed my asvab test and scored a 48..they say i can choose..AO,QM,SH,MA,CS..can some one tell me about those rates and the good and bad..
reply: i just passed my asvab test and scored a 48..they say i can choose..AO,QM,SH,MA,CS..can some one tell me about those rates and the good and bad..
title: Navy rates

content: quote: Originally posted by 15952874: i just passed my asvab test and scored a 48..they say i can choose..AO,QM,SH,MA,CS..can some one tell me about those rates and the good and bad.. Do something that will place you right in a good civil career when you get out. MA would place you right into law enforcement. The rest I wouldn't go for unless your into personal services like cooking, restaurant management etc. Is this all they offered you? Stay out of aviation fields unless you can do ATC. Your best bet is some high tech like IT and electronics/electrical on shipboard, telecommunications is a good one.
quote: Originally posted by 15952874: i just passed my asvab test and scored a 48..they say i can choose..AO,QM,SH,MA,CS..can some one tell me about those rates and the good and bad..
reply: Do something that will place you right in a good civil career when you get out. MA would place you right into law enforcement. The rest I wouldn't go for unless your into personal services like cooking, restaurant management etc. Is this all they offered you? Stay out of aviation fields unless you can do ATC. Your best bet is some high tech like IT and electronics/electrical on shipboard, telecommunications is a good one.
title: Navy rates

content: The Navy Discussions would be the best place to ask this question. But so you know currently the MA Rate is overmanned, hard to get promotion. And just because you do law enforcement in the military doesn't mean you are guaranteed a job in that area when you leave. Many police departments are looking for degrees in Criminal or Justice Administration. And I have heard from a few people that honestly they prefer no military police experience. This message has been edited. Last edited by: Navywifeinparadise, Mon 18 May 2009 06:56 AM
reply: The Navy Discussions would be the best place to ask this question. But so you know currently the MA Rate is overmanned, hard to get promotion. title: Navy rates

content: Some I agree with, some I don't! For example, to automatically stay out of aviation fields unless it's ATC (the acronym for Air Traffic Control)! SOME of the aviation fields can lead to specialized licenses for work after you get out or not! Intell would be good. MA is, as CJ says, good for law enforcement if that's what you strive to do. What are your long term plans and goals? I cannot corrolate your ASVAB Score to what you are eligible for!
reply: Some I agree with, some I don't! For example, to automatically stay out of aviation fields unless it's ATC (the acronym for Air Traffic Control)! SOME of the aviation fields can lead to specialized licenses for work after you get out or not! Intell would be good. MA is, as CJ says, good for law enforcement if that's what you strive to do. What are your long term plans and goals? I cannot corrolate your ASVAB Score to what you are eligible for!

Your best bet is some high tech like IT and electronics/electrical on shipboard, telecommunications is a good one. I must refute your post here and now. How can you say to stay out of the Aviation ratings unless it's ATC (Air Traffic Control)? Have you served in every Aviation rating to know this? I retired with 20 years in the Aviation Community as an AT (Avionics Technician). The education and experience I received landed me a beautiful job with one of the top 5 Defense Contractors worldwide. I have an unlimited advancement potential in this job. Many Aviation Ratings are HIGHLY marketable in the civilian world. Pease do not cast dispersions where they are unwarranted. Unless you walk a mile in another man's moccassins just say, "I dont' know about the Aviation rating's though" and it will suffice. It would also help to point him/her to the navy forums too.

title: Navy rates

content: well I have been in for ten years and loved the navy. I was an AT like many others here. The Navy is (no more, no less) what you put into it, by the way 18 months you can cross rate. there are a bunch of options. Keep your own eyes and ears open and don't let other taint your views. find out for yourself. I have been incharge of some pretty unhappy Shipmates over the years because, someone had (said). Thats my 2 cents.

content: oh okay..yeah I been leaning towards QM or SH...and i plan on re taking the asvab while im in so i can get to be a MC. im only joining is to see the world and get the gi bill and also save every paycheck i get in the navy to invest in a music studio..
